text_in_pdf:
Supervisor-Agent Communication System  

This system demonstrates WebSocket-based communication between agents and a supervisor.  

Components  

1. Supervisor Server ( supervisor_server.py )  

• Runs on ws://localhost:8765 • Accepts agent connections via WebSocket • Processes decision requests and returns responses • Implements decision logic based on multiple metrics  

2. Agent Client ( connect_supervisor.py  

• Connects to the supervisor server • Sends decision requests with metrics • Receives and displays supervisor responses  

Usage  

Start Supervisor Server  

python code/supervisor_server.py  

Connect Agent (in another terminal)  

python code/connect_supervisor.py  

Run Complete Demo  

bash code/demo.sh  

Request Format  

Agents send JSON requests with this structure:  

{ "tool": "get_minimax_decision", "args": { "quality_score": 0.8, "error_count": 0, "resource_usage": 0.3, "task_progress": 0.5, "drift_score": 0.1 }   
}  

Response Format  

Supervisor responds with:  

{ "success": true, "decision": "ALLOW", "score": 0.95, "timestamp": "...", "metrics": { "quality_score": 0.8, "error_count": 0, "resource_usage": 0.3, "task_progress": 0.5, "drift_score": 0.1 }   
}  

Decision Logic  

The supervisor makes decisions based on:  

- Quality Score (higher is better) - Task Progress (higher is better) - Error Count (lower is better) - Resource Usage (lower is better) - Drift Score (lower is better)  

Decision Thresholds  

• ALLOW: Overall score $\geqslant0.7$ MONITOR: Overall score $\geqslant0.4$ BLOCK: Overall score $<0.4$
